Tell lawmakers: It’s time to press pause on dystopian technology in Massachusetts.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
Take Action Now

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

We just sent a message to school administrators: don’t sell our children’s privacy to the highest bidder. Yesterday, together with education experts, advocates and teachers’ unions, we delivered a letter to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education (DESE), urging them to ban face surveillance technology in Massachusetts public schools.

Face surveillance threatens to create a world in which students are tracked at all times and treated as perpetual suspects. Our kids deserve better than to be guinea pigs for unscrupulous private tech companies and their dangerous, experimental products. But it’s not just about schools — or the future. This technology is being used right now by other state agencies.

We need to press pause on ALL government use of unregulated face surveillance. Tell lawmakers on Beacon Hill that they need to pass a statewide moratorium NOW.

Massachusetts voters overwhelmingly support a moratorium on government face surveillance. Cities like Somerville, Cambridge, and Brookline have already taken steps to safeguard the basic rights of their residents by passing or proposing municipal bans on the technology.

But it’s not enough. This is a statewide movement, and Beacon Hill needs to get the message. We hope you’ll help us deliver it.

In solidarity,

Kade Crockford
Director, Technology for Liberty Program
ACLU of Massachusetts
